text: Rachael's Food Corporation Recalls Ready-To-Eat Meat and Poultry Wrap Products Due to Possible Listeria Contamination. The ready-to-eat meat and poultry wraps were produced from July 15, 2022, through July 20, 2022. Products include Italian Style Wrap, Turkey Club Wrap, Buffalo Style Chicken Wrap, and Chicken Caesar Wrap.
annotations: ["meat", "poultry", "wrap", "Italian Style Wrap", "Turkey Club Wrap", "Buffalo Style Chicken Wrap", "Chicken Caesar Wrap"]

text: Contaminated chocolate products found in local stores. The chocolates contained traces of nuts which were not declared on the packaging. Children who consumed the chocolates experienced allergic reactions.

FDA recalls frozen pizza due to undeclared cheese allergens. The frozen pizzas contained milk proteins that were not listed in the ingredients. Consumers with dairy allergies should avoid consumption.
Salmonella outbreak linked to contaminated eggs. Fresh eggs from local farms tested positive for salmonella bacteria. Consumers are advised to cook eggs thoroughly before eating.
Bakery recalls bread products containing wheat flour. The whole wheat bread and dinner rolls may cause reactions in people with gluten sensitivity. All wheat-based products should be returned.
